declare.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to state officially and publicly that a particular situation exists or that something is true
declare.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: A state of emergency has been declared.
Mr Steel has been declared bankrupt (=it has been officially stated that he cannot pay his debts).
We celebrate September 16, the day when Mexico declared independence from Spain  (=officially stated that it was no longer ruled by Spain).
The war was declared illegal by the International Court of Justice.
The court declared that Brown’s case should be reviewed.
Several countries wanted Antarctica to be declared a ‘world park’.
The city was declared to be in a state of siege.
I declare you man and wife.
declare.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to say publicly what you think or feel
declare.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: He declared his intention to stand for president.
Carol held a press conference and declared that she was innocent.
Edward declared himself angry and frustrated.
declare.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to state on an official government form how much money you have earned, what property you own etc
declare.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: All tips are counted as part of your earnings and must be declared.
declare.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to tell a customs official that you are carrying goods on which you should pay tax when you enter a country
declare.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to choose to end your team’s turn before all your players have batted
declare.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to make something known officially to the public
declare.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Shares in the company, which declared a £216 million loss, fell 712p to 334p.
Two dominant companies have declared major redundancy programmes in the course of restructuring.
declare.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to officially state that you are connected with something and that this might affect the decisions you make about it
declare.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: If a director is involved in any way with the contractor, he or she is required to declare his interest at the meeting of the board.
declare.translation[1].definitions[2].de: to state officially that a person or company is unable to pay all their debts
declare.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: The consequences of being declared bankrupt would be harsh and severe.
declare.translation[1].definitions[3].de: to state officially that you are unable to pay your debts
declare.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: The new law established a mechanism to declare bankruptcy.
declare.translation[1].definitions[4].de: to state whether or not you are accepting an OPTION that you hold
declare.translation[1].definitions[5].de: when a company declares a DIVIDEND, it says that it will pay a dividend to its shareholders
declare.translation[1].definitions[5].ex: Before declaring a dividend, the trustee must give notice of his intention to do so to all creditors.
declare.translation[1].definitions[6].de: to make an official statement saying how much money you have earned, what property you own etc
declare.translation[1].definitions[6].ex: A lot of childcare is in the black economy, with carers not declaring their cash payments.
Rent received from the property must be declared for tax.
declare.translation[1].definitions[7].de: to formally say that something is done, open, closed etc
declare.translation[1].definitions[7].ex: I now declare this factory open.
Anything else? No? Then I declare the meeting closed.
